options.title: -a, --all, -
options.description: Do not scan only the initialized and loaded sections of object files; scan the whole files.

options.title: -a, --all, -
options.description: Do not scan only the initialized and loaded sections of object files; scan the whole files.

options.title: -f, --print-file-name
options.description: Print the name of the file before each string.

options.title: -f, --print-file-name
options.description: Print the name of the file before each string.

options.title: --help
options.description: Print a summary of the program usage on the standard output and exit.

options.title: -min-len, -n min-len, --bytes=min-len
options.description: Print sequences of characters that are at least min-len characters long, instead of the default 4.

options.title: -min-len, -n min-len, --bytes=min-len
options.description: Print sequences of characters that are at least min-len characters long, instead of the default 4.

options.title: -o
options.description: Like -t o. Some other versions of strings have -o act like -t d instead. Since we can not be compatible with both ways, we simply chose one.

options.title: -t radix, --radix=radix
options.description: Print the offset within the file before each string. The single character argument specifies the radix of the offset---o for octal, x for hexadecimal, or d for decimal.

options.title: -t radix, --radix=radix
options.description: Print the offset within the file before each string. The single character argument specifies the radix of the offset---o for octal, x for hexadecimal, or d for decimal.

options.title: -e encoding, --encoding=encoding
options.description: Select the character encoding of the strings that are to be found. Possible values for encoding are: s = single-7-bit-byte characters (ASCII, ISO 8859, etc., default), S = single-8-bit-byte characters, b = 16-bit bigendian, l = 16-bit littleendian, B = 32-bit bigendian, L = 32-bit littleendian. Useful for finding wide character strings.

options.title: -e encoding, --encoding=encoding
options.description: Select the character encoding of the strings that are to be found. Possible values for encoding are: s = single-7-bit-byte characters (ASCII, ISO 8859, etc., default), S = single-8-bit-byte characters, b = 16-bit bigendian, l = 16-bit littleendian, B = 32-bit bigendian, L = 32-bit littleendian. Useful for finding wide character strings.

options.title: --target=bfdname
options.description: Specify an object code format other than your system's default format.

options.title: -v, --version
options.description: Print the program version number on the standard output and exit.

options.title: -v, --version
options.description: Print the program version number on the standard output and exit.
